content.question: Which of the following describes the likely context of the author’s claim that formerly enslaved people have “a right to the land”?

choices.label: Southern plantation owners agreed to sell their land to formerly enslaved people.
Southern state legislatures were forcing formerly enslaved African Americans to migrate North.
Political leaders were attempting to exile the formerly enslaved Black population to parts of West and Central Africa.
Land that was initially distributed to newly freed people was confiscated and given back to former enslavers.

content.answer: Land that was initially distributed to newly freed people was confiscated and given back to former enslavers.
